description: Didn't open in Ubuntu 22.04

The fact that software this bad has been out for over a decade and is still this horrible is mind blowing. 

When adding clips to a timeline, the order appears to be random. There is no way to sort by filename, which would be one way to overcome that. The interface allows reordering clips before adding them, but anytime you move a clip up/down it scrolls back to the top which is suprt inconvenient if the number of clips being added requires a vertical scroll bar. Continually have to save/close/restart to avoid memory leaks. After being unable to export a single project to a video (because of memory leaks), I decided to do it in parts and use something else to put it back together, but it autosaved a temp version onto the main version so I could no longer export the remaining portions. This is by far one of the absolute worst peices of software I have been subjucted to in a long time.
summary: Horrible interface with some memory leaks on the side

description: It doesn't launch.
Can't open app. 1 star but for Aplication .

I used to use Openshot for all my video work .. sadly now it won't even open. The Appimage version won't work either with error message "WARNING webengine: WebEngine backend still not ready after XXX retries' which hasn't be solved by any web advice I have tried.
summary: Doesn't work under Ubuntu 22.04 - so disappointed

description: Ubuntu 22.04 , Does not open.
I used a lot the Windows version and I wanted to use it in Linux too. But sadly it's not working. Hopefully it will be fixed.

Well to start snap didnt work openshot would open but no time line would show so openshot wouldnt work but good news is install it from flathub and it works fine and I would like to add I found this to be in most cases. ubuntu 22.04

Open shot works only if you place 1 or two videos to play and it is same with the rendering. I guess that is the limit, because if you place three videos in order to render it then the play stop at the third video and it is same issue with the rendering of a same AV material.

Imported a V9 640x480 Video
preview image shows black screen most of the time
seems unable to select a specific frame to cut
selected V9 va codec for export, but as my device not supporting it openshot just crashed
exporting the 640x480 V9 video as 640x480 V9 video produces the correct dimensions of the video, but with black borders and a distorted image

description: SOOO BUGGY. CRASHES. AUDIO LAG. SUCKS AT RENDERING. REMOVE IT.

I didn't do much video editing before, but recently needed to edit a video, just to trim the edges of the video. I tried with another software, and probably couldn't figure out how to do that, and it ended up rendering the completed file in 1.5 hours. Whereas, I was straight into the task with OpenShot and it handled the job a lot more quickly. Then I discovered a lot more features from the youtube channel and what I liked it achieving the same function in multiple ways, which is like linux, gives choices to the user. Awesome!
summary: Beginner friendly and full of features

this app is best in 2020.it is so good

I like it because it is simple and it has everything you need. The interface is nice and modern. I recommend it.

description: I loaded a simple MP4 file to edit. The editor could not play the video without huge stuttering. Attempts to simply splice sections of the video in the UI had lags of 10+ seconds. It was simply unusable. I can't imagine doing real work with this.

I love this, but it is really sad that you have to go to their website to get the updated version. It is easy to use and really have what we amateurs need. Please update it here in Ubuntu Software or this will die away like so many others who make it difficult for users to download and update.

description: I can't even start the app.
It looks like a good editor, but I can't use it. It crashes almost immediately I start working.

Does not start when installed from package manager on OpenSuse
Maybe the appimage will work???

I don't usually review software on Ubuntu Software, but seeing OpenShot sitting at 3 stars is just not right. 

I use it to edit the videos I create for courses I deliver. I merge and cut multiple videos/audio sources and even used it to censor out parts of the screen that were confidential in video as they moved around. I am no video editor, this is not even like a side job for me but I was able to do it thanks to Openshot.

It has everything you need, so its user interface is a bit complex compared to more app like software. Other than that I don't see any reason why it wouldn't be a 5 star piece of software.
Randomly crashed during working or when I try to export a video.

This software is *horrendously* slow. For context, I'm editing a simple 4 minute, 1080p video, and just to adjust the scale of the video (because OpenShot decides to scale down a 1080p video by almost half, even when using a 1080p viewing profile), it takes on average 20-30 seconds for each action, due to the software locking up. And before anyone mentions my hardware, I have a GTX 3080 and a Ryzen 7 5800X, with 32 GB of RAM. This is terrible software, avoid at all costs, *literally*!
summary: Horribly slow and prone to crashing

description: It worked completely fine under Windows, but now under Arch Linux it doesn't work at all. :(

OpenShot is a very usable and dependable video editor. I've been using it for several years now on my hobby video editing. Does everything I need and it's a lot more than simple video cutting. Would like to give 5 stars but it's sometimes a little buggy, not enough to annoy, though.

I'm coming from Power Director 19, looking for a good video editor for Linux. Something more than just basic trimming. I thought OpenShot was it but for the life of me I can't figure out why transitions don't work as expected. Overlapping two segments will produce a good cross fade, but trying to implement any transition across segments from the presets causes weird wonky results. Maybe I'm missing something. I'll give it a bit more time and revisit if I figure out why transitions aren't working correctly.
It crashed some times but not that much.
So bad even for basic cut-and-trim editing.

Great app;
 occasionally when trying to export a file, it will crash, but not often
Used to work fine but this version and the AppImage version is getting hung up after some time or if any new modification is tried

I went to the bugs page and deleted the log files as per instructions. Then I ran the following in terminal, and after going to software and updating it worked 
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:openshot.developers/ppa
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install openshot-qt
summary: At first it didn't work then I went to their page and found a fix

description:
First, I have been using this program for some time now. And I found out somethings about why it crashes. My laptop has 8 GB of memory and if I use OpenShot for creating a video that is over 20 to 25 minutes long I need to save my work close the program and then reopen it and continue. Also when I complete the video I then close again then re-start it again before Exporting video to an mp4 file.
I don't have this problem with my desktop which has 16 GB memory. I just finished a 42-minute video and never had to close it and it never crashed.
I believe the problem is in the code and it is not releasing the memory so when it runs out it gets flaky and locks up.
I am going to give it 4 stars because I have created over 2000 videos with OpenShot, and I love it.
summary: If you have problems read this review

description: Never got to try the program, it just locks up my computer every time.

If you start a project on one computer and you try to edit it on another, it will crash. I setup the same file structure and it still crashes. Just thought I would let all know this. I use a desktop when home and a laptop when on the road. You have to start and finish the project on the same machine.
its a lot better then most editors has more variety and more options then cyberlink i enjoy using it it also has better file size capabilities

description:
Ok i see some stupid ratings with stupid reasons , I have old PC it's slow..Video editing is not for SLOW pc's minimal a quadcore laptop .. so shut the hell up with your nonsense ..All you bad raters should go back where you came from , probably Windows xp and go play with your moviemaker there ..but don't come cry here ..

Honnest review? 

THIS VIDEO EDITOR IS A AMAZING UPDATE IN GNU WORLD AND VERY USER FRIENDLY AND OF COURSE NEEDS A PC WITH RAM AND POWER TO PROCESS VIDEO AND AUDIO ..

This is a combination of Moviemaker from windows and Camtasia ..
This video editor can export in various formats and is all a video creator (With a good PC ) needs to get by.

Thanks so much for this development and Channel48 YOUTUBE is standing 100% behind all of you making great software for GNU .

One love and keep developing..

And WARNING !!
BEFORE RATING THIS APP 2 or 3 STARS , FIRST TEST IT PROPERLY , Not as a NOOB!

The memory cache is extremely low at default, so only a few seconds of video load at a time. I adjusted it to 3GB, but still loaded only a few seconds of video at a time (entire file was only 95MB, so what gives?) Then the stuttering is very bad, sound cuts out randomly, and has had terrible artifacts usually toward the beginning of exported videos. The Windows 10 version isn't quite this bad, though has some issues as well. Otherwise I like it, hopefully the bugs get worked out.
Larger files seem to overload the cache causing OpenShot to freeze. Unfortunately it also freezes the computer forcing a reboot. Deja BSOD from MicroSux !
summary: Often crashes on larger files or larger formats - HD+

description:
I spent hours editing a video, trying to get frame-perfect cuts and nearly pixel-perfect overlays. OpenShot became unresponsive and used enough RAM to start swapping to disk on my 16GB system. Simple operations like seeking in the project would take 40 seconds to a minute.  I had to force-quit several times and restart the program. Well, one of those times I force quit the program, it had completely erased the project file. 

So I started over in Shotcut, which worked really well.
summary: Unstable, lost time, use Shotcut instead

description: Nach Upgrade von Kubuntu 20.04 auf 22.04 lässt sich das Programm nicht mehr starten. Auch Neuinstallation hat nichts gebracht. Schade - war vorher sehr zufrieden damit.

summary: new OpenShot version is very stable

description: Wenn ihr euch tot ärgen woll nehmt das , ansonsten Finger weg!

Mehrfach konnte ich Werbepausen herausschneiden und Videos wie gewünscht aneinanderhängen. 
Aber etliche Male stürzte der Rechner aus unerfindlichen Gründen ab - und zwar so, daß er auf nichts mehr reagierte - keine Abschaltung des Programms mehr möglich und auch keine Aktivierung irgeneiner anderen Funktion. Es blieb nur das Ausschalten durch Unterbrechung der Stromzufuhr! 
Dabei habe ich gelegentlich mehr als 10 Stunden gewartet ob es weiterging - drei Tage Warten war für mich keine Option. 

Auch irritierend: Vereinzelt wurde nur einer von vier Prozessoren zu knapp 100 % in Anspruch genommen, die anderen liefen mit 3 - 7 % Auslastung. Der belastete Prozessor blieb aber nicht konstant, sondern wechselte immer wieder nach mehreren Minuten. 

Möglicherweise arbeitet diese Software nur mit bestimmter Hardware richtig zusammen. Ich habe jetzt einen HP-Computer.
Stürzt ab, rein und raus zoomen auf der Timeline zu uSchmständlich. Habs deinstaliert.
Ist einfach zu bedienen, für kleine Projekte unschlagbar!

Ich brauchte "nur" eine Software zum Auschneiden eines Videoteils. Das war recht umständlich gelöst, funktioniert aber in den ersten 30 min des Videos. Anschließend wird die Vorschau nicht mehr aktualisiert und man muss "blind" schneiden. Das Problem ist scheinbar seit 2017 bekannt aber wurde immer noch nicht gelöst. Eine Erhöhung des Buffers brachte keine Veränderung. Somit die die Software selbst für einfache Aufgaben unbrauchbar, wird wieder deinstalliert und kann keine Sterne erhalten.
summary: Videoschnitt funktioniert nur in den ersten 30 min

J'ai réussi à surmonter le problème d'ouverture dans Ubuntu 22.04 en téléchargeant la version 2.6.1 à partir du site web du logiciel (AppImage). Ensuite il faut cocher dans les propriétés du document : Permissions / Autoriser l'exécution du fichier comme un programme.

Ne fonctionne pas sous Kubuntu. Dommage l'application est super.
depuis ubuntu 22.04 et les mises à jour ne fonctionne plus du tout. L'installation est interminable et ensuite le click sur l'icone n'entraine aucune réaction...
Désynchronisation image/son

Mon ordi marche impecable avec KDenlive et ShotCut sans aucuns problémes. L'utilisation d'OpenShot est catastrophique : ralentissement puis plantage complet, il faut redémarrer pour se sortir de ce mauvais pas. Fuyez et ne perdez pas votre temps avec un soft autant buggé.Pourquoi le proposer au téléchargement ?

Logiciel plutôt facile à prendre en main.
Le logiciel dispose de pas mal de fonctions comme rajouter des titres, faire des transitions diverses, fondu d'une vidéo sur l'autre, séparation de l'audio de la vidéo et gestion de l a luminosité/contraste/chroma.

On réalise ce qu'on appelle un montage avec des fichiers audios, vidéos et des images et on peut convertir les fichiers en plus. Bien sûr, suivant les capacités de l'ordinateur et il a parfois une lecture difficile quand on teste mais quand on exporte le fichier tout est bon.

Très aisé de prise en main.
Utilisation facile et fiable.
Très gourmand en ressources.
Plantage sur les grosses vidéos.
Ne se lance plus avec la 22.04
summary: Ne se lance plus avec la 22.04

description: plante tout le temps,et pour rien
summary: à supprimer du repo rpmfusion fedora 36

description: Ne se lance pas avec Ubuntu 22.04 - Bon logiciel (avant !)
summary: Ne se lance pas avec Ubuntu 22.04

description: inutilisable sur ubuntu

OpenShot, application que j'utitlise avec bonheur de puis des années, ne démarre pas sous Kubuntu 22.04.
Quand à la version appimage, elle démarre bien, seul problème, elle n'affiche pas les pistes, ce qui la rend inutilisable.
Je gage que ce bug sera rapidement corrigé.
Simple et efficace. Le nec.

Le logiciel a parfois de longs moments où çà rame, voire il s'arrête. Il faut être très patient. Les possibilités sont limitées, et les manipulations ne sont pas très intuitives, quant à l'exportation, elle n'est pas aussi fidèle que le projet. C'est bien pour des petits montages avec des transitions simples.
prend énormémént de resources pour pas grand chose

Le meilleur rapport simplicité / fonctionnalités. Il est assez intuitif et assez stable. Quelques moments où ça rame. Mais une assez bonne gestion des sources, des images clés. Bref, de tous les logiciels libres existants, c'est celui que j'ai choisi.
La version téléchargée sur le site en appimage est plus récente que celle proposée dans les dépôts.
Très simple d'utilisation et intuitif, propose de nombreusees fonctionnalités... Pour un logiciel gratuit, je ne vois pas ce qu'on pourrait demander de plus !
Je ne peut pas suppromer l'application car j'ai fait annuée durant la préparation

L'application plante souvent, et celle-ci est malheureusement orienté vers un montage simple, pas assez d'effet, et de fonctionnalités. Mais elle reste tout de même efficace pour modifier légèrement la vidéo avec un montage léger.
Pour des montages simples, c'est pas mal.

Openshot ne fonctionne pas avec Blender (pb pour ajouter des titrages), bug reporté X fois depuis des années. Apparemment le pb vient de la version disponible sur la logithèque : conseil aller directement sur le site d'openshot
summary: la version des dépôts est buggée

description: simple, et ça marche !
Promising software which cover basics functions such as video editing and audio syncing. But lacks easy subtitling. Uninstalled and went with the appImage more up to date.
Je réalise depuis dix ans mes vidéos à destination de internet avec ce programme.

Удобно и просто
Самый удобный видеоредактор из всех свободных.
нельзя добавить видео для обработки

было бы не плохо, чтоб в приложении появилась возможность записывать аудио-дорожку с микрофона. Допустим я хочу озвучить свой видеоролик прямо в программе, для этого нужно добавить дополнительную аудио-дорожку и на нее записать свой голос, но сейчас в программе нет данного функционала и это очень плохо.
Категорически подтверждаю!
Спасибо огромное разработчикам! Эта программа самая-самая лучшая. Я не пробывал другие, и не хочу. В этой программе все есть. Правда только система титров не очень удобная... Но а так все отлично!
Хороший видеоредактор

При посекундном отображении временной шкалы цифры на шкале не видны после 00:05:27, и сама шкала тоже не расчерчена. 
Проверял на трёх разных компьютерах: дома в Kubuntu 20.04, на работе вначале в Ubuntu 18.04, потом в Kubuntu 20.04. и на компьютере с Windows 7. Железо тоже отличается - дома AMD Ryzen 3 3200G, на работе какой-то из Pentium G.
